interface.description: Settings related to the user interface and experience

tooltips.description:
Show tooltips when your mouse is over a tooltip supported button.
This is not hot reloaded.

nerd_font.description:
Use nerd font for rendering icons instead of weird characters and stuff.
Not properly hot-reloaded.

use_reactive_layout.description: Hide certain elements based on the width and height of the terminal.

show_progress_eta.description: When copying or deleting files, show an ETA for when the action will be completed.

show_progress_percentage.description: When copying or deleting files, show a percentage of how much had been completed.

truncate_progress_file_path.description: When the process container is using file paths, truncate the file path to only view the first and last names of the path.

show_line_numbers.description: Add line numbers to the left gutter if you are viewing a text file.

scrolloff.description: The number of files to keep above and below the cursor when moving through the file list.

show_hidden_files.description: Show hidden files and folders (those starting with a dot on Unix, or explicitly hidden on Windows/MacOS).

image_protocol.description: The image protocol to use when displaying an image

allow_tab_nav.description: Allow navigating the main app screen with `tab` and `shift+tab`

append_new_tabs.description:
Choose whether or not to append new tabs instead of inserting them.
`true` => Append to the end of the tab list.
`false` => Insert after the active tab.

double_click_delay.description: The delay between two consecutive clicks to enter into a directory, or open a file.

drive_watcher_frequency.description: How often (in seconds) to check for changes in mounted drives in the sidebar.

enabled.description: Show a clock in the tabs bar.

align.description: Align the clock to either the 'right' or 'left' of the tabs bar.

error.description: If for any reason the file preview refused to show, this appears.

start.description: This is shown when the rovr starts up. You may see it for a split second, but it will never appear afterwards. You cannot view this properly in this docs.

buttons.description: Whether to compact the buttons and path input to one line instead of three.

panels.description: Whether to make the panels smaller to add more room for the file list itself

mime_rules.description:
Map MIME type patterns to preview types. Supports glob patterns (e.g., 'text/*' matches 'text/plain', 'text/html', etc.). Valid preview types: text, image, pdf, archive, folder, remime.
-> Use 'remime' if you want a more accurate description from file(1)

settings.description: Settings related to behavior of file operations

use_recycle_bin.description: When deleting a file, allow moving the file to the recycle bin.

copy_includes_metadata.description: When copying over a file, preserve metadata from the original file, such as creation and modification times.

show_as_mapping.description: Show as a mapping of `<old> âž” <new>` instead of just `<old>`

editor.description: Settings related to the editor used for different operations

run.description: Editor to use when opening a file

block.description: Block rovr until the editor closes

suspend.description: Suspend (hide) rovr until the editor closes. Will block regardless.

file.description: Editor to use when opening a file

run.description: Editor to use when opening a folder

block.description: Block rovr until the editor closes

suspend.description: Suspend (hide) rovr until the editor closes. Will block regardless.

folder.description: Editor to use when opening a folder

run.description: Editor to use for bulk renaming

suspend.description: Suspend (hide) rovr until the editor closes

bulk_rename.description: Editor to use for bulk renaming

open_all_in_editor.description: Open all in the configured editor, regardless of file encoding or type. When disabled, it opens them in the system configured editor.

fields.description: The order of the metadata tags that you want to see in the Metadata section.

datetime_format.description: The datetime format for Metadata. Refer to https://docs.python.org/3/library/datetime.html#format-codes for more information.

filesize_decimals.description: The number of decimals you want to see in the humanized file size

pattern.description:
The glob pattern to match against the file name (e.g., '*.py', 'LICENSE').
Both the filename and glob will be forced to lowercase!

color.description: The color for the icon. Can be a named color or hex code.

files.description: Custom file icon mappings. Earlier entries have higher priority.

pattern.description:
The glob pattern to match against the folder name (e.g., 'src', '.*').
Both the folder name and glob will be forced to lowercase!

icon.description: The icon character to use (should be a nerd font character)

color.description: The color for the icon. Can be a named color or hex code

folders.description: Custom folder icon mappings. Earlier entries have higher priority.

icons.description: Custom icon configurations for files and folders

default.description: The default theme. Can be changed while in rovr, but it is not persistent.

preview.description: The theme to use when previewing files in the preview sidebar.

name.description: A name for the theme. However, when the theme is available in the theme picker, it shows up as a hyphenated, lowercase version.

primary.description: A hex code or named color to use as the primary color. Refer to https://textual.textualize.io/css_types/color/#named-colors for the named colors.

secondary.description: A hex code or named color to use as the secondary color. Refer to https://textual.textualize.io/css_types/color/#named-colors for the named colors.

warning.description: A hex code or named color to use as the warning color. Refer to https://textual.textualize.io/css_types/color/#named-colors for the named colors.

error.description: A hex code or named color to use as the error color. Refer to https://textual.textualize.io/css_types/color/#named-colors for the named colors.

success.description: A hex code or named color to use as the success color. Refer to https://textual.textualize.io/css_types/color/#named-colors for the named colors.

accent.description: A hex code or named color to use as the accent color. Refer to https://textual.textualize.io/css_types/color/#named-colors for the named colors.

foreground.description: A hex code or named color to use as the foreground color. Refer to https://textual.textualize.io/css_types/color/#named-colors for the named colors.

background.description: A hex code or named color to use as the background color. Refer to https://textual.textualize.io/css_types/color/#named-colors for the named colors.

surface.description: A hex code or named color to use as the surface color. Refer to https://textual.textualize.io/css_types/color/#named-colors for the named colors.

panel.description: A hex code or named color to use as the panel color. Refer to https://textual.textualize.io/css_types/color/#named-colors for the named colors.

bar_gradient.description: The gradient colors for the progress bar.

default.description: A list of hex codes, or named colors to use as the progress bar's gradient colors. Refer to https://textual.textualize.io/css_types/color/#named-colors for the named colors.

error.description: A list of hex codes, or named colors to use as the progress bar's gradient colors **when it encountered an error**. Refer to https://textual.textualize.io/css_types/color/#named-colors for the named colors.

is_dark.description: Whether or not this theme is a dark type theme.

variables.description:
Extra variables to set unique to the theme.
Refer to https://textual.textualize.io/guide/design/#additional-variables for more information.

toggle_pin.description: Toggle the current folder in the Pinned Folder Sidebar.

focus_toggle_pinned_sidebar.description: Toggle focus between pinned folder sidebar and file list.

focus_toggle_preview_sidebar.description: Focus toggle between preview sidebar and file list.

focus_toggle_path_switcher.description: Focus toggle between path switcher and file list.

copy.description: Copy the selected files in the file list to the clipboard.

paste.description: Paste the selected files in the clipboard into the current directory.

cut.description: Cut the selected files in the file list to the clipboard.

delete.description: Delete the selected files in the file list.

delete_files.description: Keybinds related to the delete confirmation screen

trash.description: Confirm deletion and move files to the recycle bin.

delete.description: Confirm deletion and permanently delete files.

cancel.description: Cancel deletion and go back to the main screen.

rename.description: Rename the selected file in the file list to something else.

new.description: Create a new item in the current directory.

toggle_all.description: Enter into select mode and select/unselect everything.

zip.description: Create a zip archive from selected files.

extra_copy.description: Keybinds related to extra copy options

open_popup.description: Open the menu with extra copy options.

copy_to_rovr.description: Copy the selected files to rovr's clipboard

copy_single_path.description: Copy only the highlighted file's path to the system clipboard

copy_to_system_clip.description: Copy the selected files to the system clipboard

copy_current_directory.description: Copy the current directory's path to the system clipboard

up.description: Go up the file list options.

down.description: Go down the file list options.

down_tree.description: Go down the file tree, or open the currently selected item.

page_up.description: Page Up in the file list options.

page_down.description: Page Down in the file list options.

home.description: Go to the first option in the file list options.

end.description: Go to the last option in the file list options.

toggle_hidden_files.description: Toggle the visibility of hidden files (dot-prefixed on Unix, or flagged hidden on Windows/macOS).

select_up.description: While in visual mode, extend the selection up.

select_down.description: While in visual mode, extend the selection down.

select_page_up.description: While in visual mode, extend the selection to the previous page.

select_page_down.description: While in visual mode, extend the selection to the next page.

select_home.description: While in visual mode, extend the selection to the first option.

select_end.description: While in visual mode, extend the selection to the last option.

tab_next.description: Go to the next tab, if it is available.

tab_previous.description: Go to the previous tab, if it is available.

show_keybinds.description: Show the keybinds list with all available keybinds.

change_sort_order.description: Keybinds related to changing the sort order

open_popup.description: Open the change sort order popup.

command_palette.description: Launch Textual's mildly useful command palette (only one keybind is allowed!)

suspend_app.description: Suspend the app's process, bringing you back to the terminal

open_editor.description: Open the selected file or folder in the configured editor.

filename_conflict.description: Keybinds related to handling a conflict with two files of the same name

overwrite.description: Overwrite the existing file with the new file.

skip.description: Skip this file and do not copy/move it.

rename.description: Rename the new file being copied/moved.

dont_ask_again.description: Apply the selected action to all future conflicts without asking again.

file_in_use.description: Keybinds related to handling a file that is in use by another process

retry.description: Retry the operation on the file.

skip.description: Skip this file and do not copy/move it.

dont_ask_again.description: Apply the selected action to all future 'file in use' errors without asking again.

filter_modal.description: Keybinds related to selecting options in a modal screen (like FileSearch or ZDToDirectory)

exit.description: Exit the modal without making a selection.

down.description: Move the selection down in the modal list.

up.description: Move the selection up in the modal list.

yes_or_no.description: Keybinds related to yes/no confirmation modals

dont_ask_again.description: Apply the selected action to all future confirmations without asking again.

keybinds.description: The keybind to open the zoxide modal.

show_scores.description: Display zoxide frequency scores alongside directory paths.

enabled.description: Enable or disable bat for previewing files.
Enable recursive file search using fd.

keybinds.description: The keybind to open the file search picker.

relative_paths.description: Whether to show fd results as relative path or absolute path.

follow_symlinks.description: Whether fd should follow symlinks when searching.

no_ignore_parent.description: Don't use *ignore files from parent folders when searching.

default_filter_types.description: The default file types to show when using fd.

keybinds.description: The keybind to open the content search picker.

case_sensitive.description: Whether the search should be case sensitive by default.

follow_symlinks.description: Whether rg should follow symlinks when searching.

no_ignore_parent.description: Don't use *ignore files from parent folders when searching.

search_hidden.description: Whether to search hidden files by default.

threads.description: How many threads should poppler use?

use_pdftocairo.description: Use pdftocairo instead of pdftoppm, may help performance

poppler_folder.description: Path to the folder where Poppler-related binaries are located. Leave empty to use the system PATH.

pdf_batch_size.description: Number of PDF pages to load in each batch.

enabled.description: Enable secondary file(1) type detection if both puremagic and plaintext detection fails.

get_description.description: Use file(1) to get additional information of the file type.
